page.title: 12Clay Workings
page.content: The Brick industry can be traced back to the 17th century with reference in parish registers to bricklayers.The present industry began in the 19th century with references to a Brickfield and kiln at Caulcott and Marston in 1881. The Marston Valley Brick Company became established at the end of the last century and was taken over by the London Brick Company.Clay extraction began in the Brogborough 2 pit after the 2nd World War to serve the Ridgmont Brickworks.The pit is 270 acres in area and a major scar on the landscape.It is being filled from south to north with domestic waste.Eventually the restored land may be capable of agricultural use.
